name: Jolyon's Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: A great little hotel in a good spot in Cardiff Bay. They do a lot of things really well here. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy and there is proper coffee in the bedrooms! The bedlinen is of good quality. Bedroom 2 has a jacuzzi bath (although it was really loud so I was worried about using it as noise did travel through the bedroom walls). No shower!
reviews.title: Small and (almost) perfectly formed

reviews.text: The bar is lovely, warm and cosy and very comfortable place to chill out in big sofas in front of the fire. Had to drag ourselves out of there.
reviews.title: Third visit!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel because of location and based on previous reviews. We had a second floor room overlooking the Roald Dahl Plas and Millenium Centre. It also helped having the best weather for years during our stay! The room was fine, though the shower over bath sprayed over onto floor as no shower screen. I don't think it's really a boutique hotel but I didn't book it because it professed to be. Only minor gripes - pedal bin in room didn't work, old fashioned tv (they should've had a small flat screen at least for the price, although I don't tend to watch much tv on holiday), bar area very understaffed - the staff were great but the owner should look at providing additional staff at busy times to help the others out. Breakfast was good although it was served in the bar area but they obviously had limited space for a separate breakfast area. Nice beer garden area. All in all a pleasant stay and the location makes up for any minor issues. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in fantastic location

reviews.text: It was one of those experiences, started with getting to the hotel to find the annual beer festival across the road. Luckily that ended early. Lovely room with a great balcony. Comfortable, and well fitted out.
reviews.title: Lovely place in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a trip to visit our son in Cardiff. The website looked good, the reviews seemed good, it has parking and everything we required. However, upon arriving it seems there are two hotels with the same name in different parts of Cardiff. On their website it lists Cardiff Bay, which is the one we booked at and for all intents the only one they advertise. It seems there is no parking there, the gallery pictures on the website do not reflect the hotel itself and in all honesty neither do the reviews taking this into account. Upon arrival the young man apologised but didn't seem at all surprised that we were expecting parking, showed me up to the room and gave directions to a carpark to my hubby. The best way I can describe the decor is "tired", I can't fault the cleaning, the place was lovely and clean, but simply worn out, ripped wall paper, stains which someone has clearly tried to clean but failed on carpets and walls alike.
reviews.title: I want to come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited this hotel last weekend after visiting friends in Monmouth. Have never been to Cardiff Bay or indeed Cardiff City, so was pleased with my overall choice of Hotel. As said in previous reviews, this hotel is a little gem of a place. I was away with my partner enjoying a relaxing weekend with friends and hoping to spend some quality time together...to which we did. I changed room from my initial online booking to a room at the front of the hotel (room 2), for a slight increase in cost, well worth it, ended up with the room with the whirlpool bath...which was great fun.
reviews.title: A Cwtch All Round...

reviews.text: The room itself overlooks the Oval Basin where on a sunny day (which it was) is very busy with people drinking in the bars and restaurants. You certainly won't go hungry in Cardiff Bay. Notwithstanding, this review is about the hotel. The Manager James is a treasure, most helpful and curtious, he couldn't have been more helpful advising us of the best car park (£7 for 24 hours parking) - do please ask them where this car park is as the other one more local is £20 for 24 hours.... Upon arrival we were shown to our room and given some bottled water and some freshly based Welsh Cakes (yummy). The room was very clean and tidy and again the view is great from the window. Bathroom is well decorated and the bath finishes it off. Only downside is that the bathroom has a massive window, which is great for makeup etc, but you have to keep the blind down as otherwise everybody outside can see in.... including being seen on the loo !! One slight criticism I would add is that the rooms really could do with updated LCD TV's - I found trying to get the tv to work impossible until we turned it on left it with a fuzzy screen and took the door key card out of the socket and put it back in ...and magic it worked...little tip for those struggling like I did. Maybe there is method in their maddess not to update them into the 21st Century in fear of would be rock stars wanting to throw them out the window....cos nobody will have the strength to lift it off and 'chuck it' out the window !!! (by the way I work for Panasonic - I'm sure I could do you a good deal on a job lot of LCD's ?)
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a perfect place to stay if you're wanting to experience Cardiff Bay by day or night... It's a step out of the hotel front door, and you're in the hub of all the atmosphere, but not to the point of being disturbed by lots of noise...although I suppose there must be but we were out for the evening in Cardiff City Centre. I probably made a bit of noise coming home at 1pm and wanting my photo taken outside the hotel....well I was a little drunk.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in the Bay

reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was lovely, juice, cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, full Welsh breakfast, tea, coffee, preserves.... all that was missing was prunes which are obligatory when staying away...it's the only time I ever eat them !! James was on breakfast duty and was very chatty.
reviews.title: A Great Find

reviews.text: So all in all a very pleasant stay in Cardiff Bay.... I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody - I do like to always stay somewhere different, but would certainly come to Jolyon's Hotel again if ever visiting Cardiff Bay. Thank you to James and all his staff for making it a very enjoyable weekend for me and my girl..... The Jolyon's Boutique Hotel is a must for those wanting something quaint, quirky and with the delights of a great 'Cwtch' from your stay.
reviews.title: Great location and a good bar

reviews.text: Have just returned from a weekend at the Jolyon's for a friend's hen weekend. When the taxi driver dropped me off at the hotel I honestly thought he'd taken me to the wrong place, he hadn't it just doesn't look like the photos on the website. Great location right opposite the millenium stadium and a short walk from some nice bars, restaurants and a few shops. We (7 ladies of 30 something age) weren't there for a quiet peaceful weekend, but beware if you stay here, which i would again just don't stay on the back of the building, i was in room 4 and friends were in room 1 and both were very noisy about 7am - 8.30 with one of the pubs at the back emptying there bottles into the bins, not a fault of the hotels but doesn't make you want to stay there. Maybe the hotel needs triple glazing or needs to ask the pub to wait until a more reasonable time to do this? The rooms and the hotel/b&b was very clean, very well presented and the beds were very very comfy with good bedding etc. There was a few little niggles which i would've expected a boutique hotel to have done something about, i.e. 2 spotlights in bathroom had gone, there was black mould in the grout on the sink behind the taps, the lovely big window in the bathroom looked over a busy street and beer garden where anybody sat out there would see you on toilet unless you pulled down the roller blind, would be better if they put a frosting on the glass particularly the lower part of the window at least. And lastly the lovely curtains in the bedroom had water stains up the bottom of the curtains, looked unsightly and cheapened the hotel. I cannot fault the service, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was good, although i think the sausages were under cooked. Apart from those little points which need improving, the pub downstairs could do with a bit of tlc and the drains stuck particularly by the mens toilets, also the beer garden was a bit tatty and i feel cheapens the hotel a little, a bit of tarting up to get to the same standard as the inside of the hotel and this would be a fantastic place. Would recommend anybody staying there, just get a room on the front.
reviews.title: Not boutique but not bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having booked two nights in an awful appartment just over the way from Jolyons, we decided to escape into Jolyons for one night. It may not be everybody's cup of tea, but we fell in love with it. Jolyons is just over the way from the Cardiff Millenium Centre, and ideal if you want to see a show there. The hotel only has six rooms so it's quite difficult to book at short notice, and it's popular. It's kind of an old Cardiff townhouse, with a really lovely pub in the basement. It's interesting that when a hotel gets it right, you don't mind if they don't always get it perfect. I ordered a salad from the bar, and they came out and told me they'd run out of salad. So I asked for a few olives and some bread, and they came out and said - sorry we've run out of bread. So they brought a huge breakfast bowl of olives to make up for it! As if I could have eaten all that. But the thing is I felt very happy there, very relaxed, and the staff are all friendly and really want to help you. The bar has outside seating, where we sat, but inside it's very small, terrific atmosphere, very crowded. It has a stone pizza oven, with an open fire, and so that's what they serve, and very delicious the pizzas are too. My one niggle is that they don't do Gwynt y ddraig Welsh Cider, but you can't have everything. There is a large squashy old leather corner sofa, a popcorn machine, wooden tables and incongruous decor, but it achieves naturally what so many pubs strive to achieve with fakery, and fail. Upstairs, our room had a large wooden kingsize bed, with very old looking furniture. Apparently it used to be a seamans lodge, and still has some of the original furniture - some of which might have been in our room. Having spent all my school holidays in Cardiff, I would say it was furnished just like my grandmothers house! The bed must have had a very expensive mattress, and I slept like a log despite outside noise. This hotel is not quiet, due to the nightlife in Cardiff Bay, but it is so relaxing. You can be yourself here, it's fun, you can dress up or down, you can laugh out loud and just enjoy yourself. The bathroom was lovely - large, with a hugh basin, a bidet, lovely towells, super toiletries. And, a gorgeous jacuzzi bath - our first experience of one! The shower fitting on the taps had mold on it, so I can't give 5 stars for cleanliness, but everything else was very clean. I would say there is no attempt by Jolyons to seem posh, or have the best decor, matching furnishings or anything like that, but they want guests to enjoy themselves here. The little lollipops that turn up everywhere seems to say that. Breakfast was one of the best I've ever had. They keep loading you up with toast and coffee, and the full Welsh breakfast was superbly cooked. It really was Welsh too, with lovely bacon and sausage. We asked where they got their meat from, and they told us it was all local, and mainley comes from Cardiff Market. We actually went there after, so we could bring home some sausages and bacon! When we want to go to another show at the Millenium Centre, we are coming to Jolyons. We just love the place and the people.
reviews.title: Only place to stay in Tiger Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We go Cardiff for the speedway and stayed overnight on Saturday 25th August. This is our second stay, it would have been our third if there were rooms available last year. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms well furnished, we stayed in Room 4 and my daughter & husband were in Room 3, the Welsh Breakfast is excellent as well a the location. The Bar in the cellar is great to finish the night off. If you ever travel to Cardiff and are looking for a place to stay then we would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great food

reviews.text: We stayed here at the beginning of our trip. They were so accommodating, even able to get into the room early. We had room 3, which as the website says is the smallest, but cozy. It was perfect for our needs. The location is great, with restaurants and attractions all around. And the city centre is a decent walk, or quick ride, from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great and helpful. They even stored our luggage so we could enjoy Cardiff for the day before catching the train. Thank you Jolyon's. We hope to return.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, super staff

description: This elegantly restored Georgian town house is situated in the oldest terrace in Cardiff Bay, opposite the millenium centre. We offer superb luxury accommodation, comprising of six lavishly furninshed, luxury bedrooms. Facilities include king-sized beds, Wi-fi facilities, free-to-view television, beverages, some with views of Cardiff Bay. Sumptuous en-suite bathrooms, include one with a whirlpool bath and one with a wet room appointed to the highest standards, with extra large fluffy towels, bathrobes and toiletries.Delicious full welsh breakfasts or a generous seasonal buffet are served in our Bar Cwtch. Relaxed days can be spent with a coffee or a glass of good wine or a speciality beer sitting on leather couches, with a newspaper and enjoying the cosy warmth of a wood-burning stove.Arrive with us as a customer, leave as a friend.
